Title: Dany Bittel, Macro Splats
Description: A Gaussian splat is essentially a bunch of blurry ellipsoids. Each one has a view-dependent color, using a process similar to training an AI model, you can optimize until it converges to the photos you feed in. The result is a sort of 3D photograph that can be viewed freely from any angle.

Title: Firefox is the best mobile browser
Description: Firefox is an open source, private browser, one of the few mainstream browsers that supports extensions on mobile (Android) as powerful as the desktop ones (A lot of extensions have been ported), with seamless sync and a customizable homepage.

Title: Blog Post
Description:
As games become more and more complex and the unified graphics API problem remains unsolved, one of the main problematics when making games and engines is how you handle multi-platform graphics API code. Over the years, we have seen a few APIs enter the scene trying to rule them all, but it seems like in the year 2025, this problem is still present.
Before we had the modern graphics APIs of today, we had OpenGL - a unified API, a global state, it worked everywhere and was very easy to use. However, as the years passed, and as the hardware evolved, more graphics APIs came into play. We had Direct3D, whose 11th iteration is still popular to this day in some engines, and almost 10 years ago, the arrival of Vulkan, D3D12 and Metal. Slowly but surely, OpenGL also started to fade away in the professional game engine space as it had too much driver overhead and was messier to use than newer APIs, that also exposed more features (raytracing especially).

Title: Software Architecture Horror Story
Description:
This is a tale of software architecture decision-making in large companies.
The setup As part of my job as a software architect, I had to design a solution which involved the integration between 2 systems: let’s call them A and B. They were part of a new instant payment processing flow that was beeing developed. System B had a legacy integration mechanism that was no longer supported at the architectural level.

Title: The wild vibe | jarv.org
Description: It’s wild that these days you can vibe code an entire app in the same time it would previously take to contribute a single feature. Take the RSS reader I use regularly, Newsboat. It always had a few stability issues and was only about 80% there as far as the features I wanted in a terminal-based reader. There were other alternatives that came along, but nothing matched what I was used to layout-wise.

Title: Strategic Pagination Patterns for .NET APIs - Roxeem
Description: Master offset, cursor, keyset, paged, time-based, and hybrid pagination patterns in .NET APIs to balance performance, consistency, and client experience.

Title: No, Sysco Is Not “Ruining Restaurants”
Description: There’s a meme going around that Sysco is “ruining restaurants”, and it’s spreading fast, probably because it feeds way too easily into recurring consumer fears concerning food quality, corporations, and homogenization.
